intro: Leschenaultia biloba var. huntsii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved leschenaultia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun, displaying vibrant yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its narrow, linear leaves are adapted to reduce water loss, making it well-suited for arid environments. This species is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
